discussion.content:
To ensure that App1 is installed before App2 on every device using Microsoft Intune, you should configure App1 as a dependency for App2 via App2 deployment configurations Dependencies section. This way, Intune will automatically install App1 first, followed by App2

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune/apps/apps-win32-add

Selected Answer: C
questione already present

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 subscription.

You use Microsoft Intune to manage devices.

You plan to deploy two apps named App1 and App2 to all Windows devices. App1 must be installed before App2.

From the Intune admin center, you create and deploy two Windows app (Win32) apps.

You need to ensure that App1 is installed before App2 on every device.

What should you configure?

discussion.content:
Verification code: User2, User3, and User4 only (They all have the Software OATH token)
Text: User1 only (Have a Mobile Phone and only gets Text or Calls)

given are wrong
verification code: 2 , 3 and 4. they all have oath
text only 1 , has a mobile phone

Verification code should be user 2, 3 and 4 due to OATH
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/entra/identity/authentication/concept-authentication-oath-tokens

Selected Answer: A

it‘s easy to choose，A Widnows Qfe
Quick Fix Engineering

Selected Answer: A
A QFE is often a quick update meant to fix a critical issue without waiting for the release of more comprehensive updates. It is intended for users or organizations that need an immediate solution to a specific problem
https://learn.microsoft.com/it-it/windows/win32/cimwin32prov/win32-quickfixengineering

Which type of app should you deploy?

Device query is currently only supported on devices running Windows 10 and later.

Device query only works on Win 10 and later

comments.content: Device query in Microsoft Intune is currently only supported on corporate-owned Windows 10 or later devices that are Microsoft Entra joined.
